reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can i say that has not all ready been said.Amazing,Freddy and his family make you feel at home the minute you walk in their door.We loved every minute of our stay.The food is very good,cooked by Freddy dad,you get the choice of two meals every evening,the soups for starters where very good.The views are just to die for,hotel very clean.Freddy took us on the gorge trip,well worth the visit.Thank you Freddy for our anniversary treat,it was delicious.Hoping to visit again soon.If you are thinking of going to this part of Austria stay at the Krinserhof,the reviews really do say it all.
reviews.title: 25 ANNIVERSARY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Krinserhof for 10 days in June 2011. Having chosen this accommodation from the Crystal catalogue, it was then highly recommended by a friend of ours. It turned out to be a very good decision. This family run small hotel is owned by the Binder family who, without exception, are all extremely friendly and attentive. (Even after waking them up at 1.45am because I had forgotten to take my front door key, I was still greeted with a smile) It is situated a little way from the centre and on rising ground but benefits from being quiet and secluded after the bustle of the day. The room we had with a balcony was ample for our needs with a beautiful view. The food was excellent and plentiful. Anyone who is thinking of staying in Seefeld could do no better than choosing Freddie and his family for their vacation.
reviews.title: Everyone should stay with Freddie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Krinserhof at the start of July this year. Like a few other people posting here, we also chose this hotel over others because of more favourable reviews on this site.
reviews.title: Little Gem in the Tirol !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Krinserhof really does live up to the hype here. Freddy and his parents are the most wonderful hosts – Freddy in particular effervesces every waking moment and is only too happy to help wherever and whenever he can. The guest-house atmosphere is much more friendly than face-less hotel chains.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on a trip with Freddy to the Partnach-Gorge (run two times per week) which we would highly recommend to anyone as it is spectacular to see and Freddy’s commentary there and back is simply something you don’t get on the train J
reviews.title: we love to return to the Krinserhof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "Welcome to our home" was the welcome from Frau Binder when we arrived which said it all about this wonderful hotel. Freidrick her son was a fantastic host and made sure we had as much info on the surrounding area that was needed.. Our trip with him to the Gorge and then into Bavaria and the beautiful town of Mittanwald was fantastic, nothing was any trouble to him. The food was prepared by his father who made sure all meals were varied and covered all tastes, even a year old baby who kept everyone entertained. One night we had a Fondue evening which was different and very enjoyable.There was an Austrian music evening performed by Frau Binder who played the harp and her parents playing various instruments it was a memorable evening. All in all this was a wonderful holiday thanks to the Binder family.
reviews.title: "What a Gem"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for 10 nights at the Krinserhof and found it to be one of the friendliest hotels we have every stayed in. The Binder Family made us so welcome and the relaxed family atmosphere was lovely. We had lovely home cooked food and nothing was too much trouble for them. Their son Friedrich was wonderful, he helped us in so many ways and gave us all the information we needed to make the most of or stay in Seefeld. Everyone staying at the same time shared our view of the hotel and we can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Warm Welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Summer loving
reviews.title: Summer loving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a wonderful relaxing week in Seefeld at the delightful, Hotel Krinserhof with my husband and one year old daughter.  The owner's son, Freidrich, and the rest of the family couldn't have been more helpful.  They had even put a proper cot in our room (so much better for sleep than a travel cot). They were always helpful with our baby requests, bottles, hot water and dish washing..and our daughter loved the breakfasts.....we ended up leaving her sleeping in the room while we were at dinner with monitor and checked lots. Town a nice ten minutes walk away were you can get all necessities. Great place to explore the region. We had a Phil and ted and baby back pack so managed loads of great walks.  Trains and buses also super if you need them.  Also great Swimming pool/leisure centre in town if you fancy a swim outside over looking the mountains and meadows. Great destination for very young families as no one else thinks to go!! Missing my cafe and kuche and three course evening meals lots.... Many thanks to Freidrich.
reviews.title: a loveley place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: this is a small family run hotel and it is great its clean an your very well looked after fredriech the son of the family runs it and he is a smashing guy .his dad is the cook and the meals are very good and the menu is varied he makes every meal very special he is a first class chehf fredrich also drove us to various sichts like the gorge and the skijump absoluteley wonderfull one evening we were entertained by the whole fami ly they performed real tirolien music very entertaining i cant praise this hotel and family enough we had a marvelous time we also went to dachou for the day highly recommended
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is an absolute gem! The rooms that our party stayed in were comfortable and most had lovely views. the food and service were fantastic - nothing was too much trouble. The family even put on entertainment (Austrian folk music ) one evening.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My Sister and I loved the hotel from the minute we arrived being met by Friedl who was more that happy to carry our cases to our room on the third floor, whilst we did not have a balcony we had a room at the front of the hotel and our photograph is the view out of the bedroom window. Our room and in fact the whole of the hotel had very typical Austrian decor and we loved the friendly atmosphere joining in with the other guests at meal times. Food was varied, plentiful and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned by others the walk from Seefeld centre back to the hotel was a little too far if you wished to go out again in the evening when you had already been out all day. Although if desparate the taxis from near the rail station charge 6 euro for any journey anywhere in town.
reviews.title: Enjoyed every minute of our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely family run pension just what I expected of Austria, natural carved wood was my favourite. Views from the front of the hotel were stunning. Nice walk up hill from the village made for peace and quiet. The family made you feel at home, with good food and company. Friedl helped us plan our walks and we had a nice trip out in his car to Garmisch Partenkirchen, where we walked down the gorge. Nothing was to much trouble. Seefeld was our first trip to Austria and I would not have missed it for the world.
reviews.title: WARM AND FRIENDLY.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice small hotel in elevated position on outskirts of village. Balconies at front face down the valley, whereas hotel backs onto woods at rear. Family owned and run and always made feel comfortable. Very friendly to all guests. Food was good to very good, albeit often simple compared to "sun and sea" package destinations. Guests are treated over dinner on one evening to their family musical entertainment night, which is most enjoyable. Room was adequate in size and traditionally furnished, with good bathroom. The standard of cleanliness throughout was very good , despite their being many objects of interest in the corridors which could easily attract dust. Hotel has many regular clients who prefer a quiet location with such an amiable local family. However, for my wife and I , there was one great disadvantage and that was the 15 minutes walking distance up from centre of village. Hotel is situated in perfect spot for accessing the Rosshute funicular railway, but the arduous incline on return for dinner denied our returning to the village again in evening. On the morning it is an easy stroll down to the bus and train stations, the scenic lake and a super large village. Seefeld is a really great resort, with many hotels, but the Krinserhof offers more competive rates being out from the village centre. Would I recommend this hotel ? Well yes, certainly, as we much enjoyed our stay but on visiting Seefeld again we would probably seek to stay at an hotel which encouraged us to enjoy an hour of the evening festivities which all Austrian resorts have during the summer months.
reviews.title: Excellent Old Fashioned Tirolean Pension.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this as a late deal wanting to return to Seefeld. All the previous reviews say it all. Although there is no TV or Wi Fi, it is clean, extremely friendly, high quality food ran by a traditional tyrolean family who cannot do enough for you.
reviews.title: Family run hotel with excellent service & high quality evening meals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We did manager Wi Fi from the front of the hotel using some open channel. TV not missed.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel with a friendly, family atmosphere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Martha hotel opposire will rent bycycles for 15 euros for the day or 10 for 1/2 day. This is the cheapest rate in town and good quality bikes. We cycled all the way to Garmish in Germany (downhill almost all of the way) and got the train back after a couple of hours in Garmish- excellent way to see the countryside. Only a slight climb out of Mittenwald.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 years ago we stayed at the 4/5 star Schonruh Wellness Hotel - again on a good late deal package, but nowhere near as cheap as here. Although the towels could do with replacing with new softer ones (our only suggestion) we would pick this over the Shonruh for the personal family orientated service and evening meals.
reviews.title: Great Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is "out of town" but only a 10 to 15 minute walk. But it is uphill and perhaps not suitable for those who have difficulty with inclines.
reviews.title: One of the best weeks of my life!
